author: stu241273
title: you'll like this.....not a lot
review:
Pros
  • Top Hat
  • Magic Wand
Cons
  • Cheap low quality materials
Mine came with hair to put on the magician while he's pulling rabbits out of his hat.  Awesome.

author: jinxjinx550
title: Nice Useful Figure & Components
review:
I quite like this magician figure, for a lot of reasons:
  • New & colorful tuxedo torso
  • Top hats are always good for cities
  • Comes with both hat AND hair
  • The magic wand!
The hair mold is not an ordinary one -- it's kind of like the city sports car driver's hair in set #8402.  Not classic old smooth hair, or puffy Harry Potter hair -- it's something new and different, which is nice.   But I particularly like the wand.  It seems to be a white bar with the center portion painted black.  It's the same diameter as the old Bar 4L (lightsaber) but shorter, so it's more in proportion with the minifig.  As far as the plastic and its quality are concerned, I couldn't really tell the difference.  Mine seems to be well made & well painted.  I really like this figure!

author: absolutelylez
title: Not the best, not the worst
review:
A few notes to make you aware of:

1. The magic stick is not as nice as it looks on the picture. The stick is black and has white printing: the white printing does not have as smooth a line as shown in the picture; the line where the white meets black is quite irregular and doesn't look that nice.

2. The hat really shows how much lower quality the plastic is. Comparing the top hat to others from other Lego sets, the Magician's one does not have any nice shine, it is quite cheap looking.

author: brixton
title: Abra-ca-da-bra
review: I picked up this mini-figure today.  I love the fact that his hands are white to represent white gloves and that he has a black and white wand.  The goatee and mustaches are a mini-figure head I have not seen before and I think it looks great.  The suit looks great too.  He also comes with a top hat and the same hair piece as the sports car mini-figure.  Overall a great set.

author: legospongepotter
title: Now you see it, now you don't.
review:
This is a great Minifigure. I got this for five bucks on eBay for my little brother's birthday. He was very happy to get it. 
It comes with this sort of baseplate that has a row of four studs in the middle for the Minifigure to stand on. 

Hat

The top-hat is my first. It is solid black and feels durable. It looks good on the Minifigure. It isn't very tall but looks just right. 

Hairpiece
I am happy it came with this hairpiece. It is short and messy black hair. I suppose you use it for those tricks like pulling a rabbit out of the hat (A rabbit piece would be really cool). It looks good on the magician.'

Head

What a realistic head! This magician looks just like a real magician. He has a yellow head, of course. He has a small triangular goatee with a long, curled mustache. He is sort of smirking and his eyebrows are made to look like he's concentrating hard. His eyes are the normal Minifigure eyes.

Torso

He has a brand new torso. He has a black jacket on. It is curved so you can see the inside at the inner edge. He has two pockets in the lower part of his torso. He has a white button-up shirt with black buttons and a collar. The shirt looks old and has some rips at the bottom. He wears a red bow near his neck. He has what looks like a large red belt, but is probably part of his shirt. He has no back-printing. He has black arms and white hands so it looks like he has white gloves on.

Legs

His legs are the standard black legs, the same color as most of his torso and his hat. However, despite the plain appearance, it looks realistic because a magician would have black pants.

Wand

The wand is another new and unique part of the magician. Like a real magic wand (or at least, a fake real wand) it has two white ends that cover all of the ends. In between in the middle is solid black. It is a regular stick that is about the size of a Harry Potter wand but this looks shorter. However, it is well designed and is cute. 

Overall

This is a good Minifigure. The design is realistic and the whole thing is a good addition to a City fan, for some sort of performance at night, for Minifigure collectors because of how unique it is, and for anyone whole likes rare pieces because of the wand. It also came with this sort of paper that tells how to put the Minifigure together and on the flip side, a list of the other Series 1 Minifigures. 

Building Experience - Well, what can you expect from a Minifigure? Because of the obvious fact you won't build much, this gets a 5

Parts - I love the wand and torso, and the hat is also cool. Then the whole Minifigure is new, so it gets a 5

Playability - Unless you can make your own props, you can't exactly do much with the Minifigure alone. However, I got a coin and was able to make a trick of my own that the magician preforms. It would be cool if there was one trick, like a rabbit, though. I give it 3.

Value for Money - 5 bucks on eBay is worth it for this Minifigure and 2 dollars, I think, in stores is a bargain. 5.

5 + 5 + 5 + 3 = 18/20 - 4/5

                                    

Definitely worth it, any Lego fan should own the magician.

author: Odeinoichus
title: ABRACADABRA!
review: Set #8683 Magician: This was my second Collectible Mini-Figure with the first Nurse I picked up. The Magician is one of the better offers from this series, it includes a new magic staff, a top hat and a hairpiece so that when he's pulling rabbits out of his hat he isn't bald. In fact I think if they'd included a little LEGO rabbit with him he'd be perfect, as it stands he's just an interesting new career type for the LEGO City universe.

author: AETerry
title: Magician Review
review:
Well.... I'm not sure why so many of the others who've reviewed the Magician before me have complained so much or have said they found this minifigure boring.

 

I for one found him to be rather intriguing, it's the classic Magician dressed in a tuxedo type suit with white gloves and top hat. His wand is the classic black with white tips too. For the design, I'd say LEGO has done very well with this minifigure.

 

New accessory with the wand, new print design for the suit. Even the face is a special print design to give him a mustache and goatee. He even came with a black hair piece so you can show him taking his hat off while doing a trick.

 

I can think of plenty of MOCs and sets to place this minifigure in, just like alot of the other Minifigures in other series runs, I'm sure people can think of a MOC where I might see limited use. Unless people just don't like classic image of a Stage Magician anymore, I think this mini is great!

author: SeptimusHeap
title: Abracadabra!
review:
This was the second minifigure I got in my stocking, along with the Pharaoh and Witch. The Magician, in my opinion, is rated much lower than it deserves.

Pros

  • Nice printed torso.
  • Great new face.
  • Excellent wand piece.

Cons

  • Boring hat and legs.

If you can find the magician, I'd take it. It's a great minifigure that has many uses.

author: K_nut
title: Look at my wand! It looks like a cane from the Oscars!
review:
Packaging

The packaging of this minifig is just like all the other collectible minifigs.

Minifig

The Magician has that Iconic look of magicians, with the curly mustache and wand, he's awesome! He has a nice, aristocrat like suit. His wand is about half the length of a regular Lightsaber blade, I think. I just know it's shorter.

Conclusion

The Magician is one of the most sadly underrated minifigs of all time. This guy gets a perfect score from me. 5/5

author: sideswinger
title: Best in the Series!
review:
So the Magician was number 9 in Series 1, and even though I don't have him, he is my favorite of the series! So let's get a more in-depth look at each part of him!

So the top hat tops him off, and I'm not sure, but I think it was new for the series, which is cool, and it has a flat top with a wide brim, and it could be used for many things, including a custom Abe Lincoln. And one of the reasons I love this figure so much, is because he not only comes with that hat, but also an alternate hair piece. And  that is the "wig boy" hair in black, which isn't too special, but still is a really nice and generous inclusion.

Next we have the face, which looks nice. I like the eyebrows and mustache, which both look great. And he has no alternate face, which is fine with me, be cause if he did, it would look awkward with that top hat piece. Still, a nice face print.

Then we have the torso, which looks excellent. He has that red bow tie as well as the red waistband, and then the white undershirt looks great as well. He also has the black overcoat printing, which looks nice as well. And he has no back torso printing unfortunately, but that's alright since this series was only 2 bucks a pop.

And the legs are just plain black; no printing whatsoever, but again, that's alright because it was only 2 bucks. I would kind of like to see a newer updated magician with leg printing and all, so who knows.

And then his accessory (besides the extra hair) is that wand piece, which looks great. It has those white bands printed around the end of the staff, and it is just the perfect accessory for a perfect figure.

And that's it for him! He is totally my favorite of Series 1, and if I wasn't one years old, I would have totally snatched up this fig. Nonetheless, this is a great figure, So thanks for reading!
